title: Network Science-Based Conceptual Change: Approaches to Language Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency and experience with digital devices
context.additional_context: Learners are general citizens with diverse background knowledge, requiring education focused on systematically connecting and reconstructing language concepts. Conducting activities using real-time interaction and network-based visualization tools in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Learners can systematically structure language concepts using network science tools (e.g., concept nodes, connection strength analysis)
Learners can quantitatively evaluate changes in their knowledge networks by comparing pre-post concept maps
Learners can propose strategies to strengthen connectivity (centrality, clustering coefficient) of language concepts through peer collaboration
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
